column4: hey: During Install the base system phase, I get this "Warning: file:///cdrom/pool/main/u/udev/udev_113-0Ubuntu16_amd64.deb was corrupt
should I continue or go back
this isnt, but it si, my first attempt at an install failed later on
is there an easier, alternate way to install Ubuntu outside of the alternate version on the website
for something that is supposed to be easy this is becoming very problematic
i was about to ask that myself, since he responded to archer, who i can't see
yes. i have seen those directions. they work for most people
if i remember right, they involve editing two files
let me find the directions and see, i have the link
ah ok i was looking at this:  http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Gutsy#Fix_Slow_boot.2Ffaulty_splash_screen
check my link, it's more detailed and i think it's for the same problem
i keep it around since your problem is pretty common. you probably have a laptop right?
well, check it anyway. i think it may be what you want
i don't know. i recall someone else had this issue, but i don't remember the fix. you can try a lower supported res, since it will only affect the boot process
it will only affect the resolution while booting, i mean
